website_summaries.verdict: An extra large, ultra comfortable inflatable camping pad.
pros: Made from high-quality materials designed to equalize pressure and provide extra support while insulating heat
cons: A bit too heavy for backpacking
On the higher end of the price spectrum

customer_reviews.title: MONEY PIT
customer_reviews.text: PAY ATTENTION! I'm JUST ONE of many similar complaints and one star reviews, because although comfortable it is NOT durable. I have been through two now, in under three years. Handle with care. Seams or valve leak with little use . No detectable holes or damage, but the pads begin to not hold air after a few uses and seemingly careful use. Customer service rather unresponsive, except to encourage me to leave a great review. Here it is. Not buying a third, that would be $270 in camp pads in three years. I'm stopping with $175 and two defunct pads. Otherwise, great pad, right? Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: m l

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I have had a better sleep after using this product, but 2 days ago it stopped holding air. I have never used it outside - it is on top of my worn out mattress and with a foam pad under it. and kinda costly for something not lasting 2 months!
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold air
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas present and just got to use it. I used it while tent camping in a clean tent with no debris underneath or anything that would cause damage. The pad self inflated as advertised however it will not hold air when you lay on it. Due to the construction of the pad I can not tell where the air is leaking so there is no way to repair it. Very disappointed. For 80 dollars I would expect it to at least work for a few trips.
customer_reviews.author: surefiredeathmachines

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but plastic valves are very fragile and prone ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, but plastic valves are very fragile and prone to cracking. One valve cracked after one use. Once cracked, it will no longer hold air.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Peifer

customer_reviews.title: I used this for less than 3 months before it ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for less than 3 months before it developed a leak from a seam and stopped holding air. Its still thick enough and soft enough so that it provides some padding anyway so its not a total loss but it was certainly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built with alien technology.
customer_reviews.text: Holy smokes, this thing is amazing! Look, these babies already have a bajillion votes and reviews saying how great they are, I don't need to pile on, but I will. What is it? It's a portable, pillowy, sack of soft amazingness that offers a good night's rest when you're trying to sleep on concrete, dirt, rocks, sticks, nails, broken glass, Legos, etc. It's thick, it's fat, it's cushy and you'll love it. If you don't love it, than you're a vampire and you enjoy sleeping hanging from your toenails. Stop reading and buy one. They even come in dark blue now!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: hip depression
customer_reviews.text: At first I was delighted with this sleeping pad, and then time wore on, a whole whopping 2 months before I started to notice that the center where my hips are when I'm sleeping was no longer inflating when I opened the mattress, now it's 4 months on and the mattress is just a little bit of filler. I'm now testing out other camp mattresses. For someone who only occasionally goes camping or the like, then this might be fine, but for boondockers who are looking for something to give them a bit of padding at night, look elsewhere. Discretion is great, but back pain sucks. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Flower Edmiston

customer_reviews.title: may be best of sleeping pads but I was still miserable
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I haven't tried a lot of sleeping pads to compare this one to so, as far as sleeping pads go, this might be the best one on the market. However, if you're like me and haven't used a sleeping pad before and want to know if $85 will make you forget you're sleeping on the ground, the answer for me was absolutely not. It did not feel "super plush". It felt like I was sleeping on a thick blanket. And not a super plush blanket.
customer_reviews.author: dudetteabides

customer_reviews.title: Just an okay mat.
customer_reviews.text: This may was okay. We went tent camping for four days. We are in our fourty’s one in good shape, and one overweight. It got down to 28 degrees. It kept us from touching the cold ground, but nights were still not real comfortable. I wouldn’t say the bed was soft. It didn’t make us feel real stiff in the morning, but we did have to stretch good in the morning after getting up. I don’t think I would buy this again. To me it was not worth what I paid, although it would have been a lot worse not having something to sleep on.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Started falling apart after 6 uses.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this air mattress, especially because it was just the right thickness for camping and because it self inflated. It only lasted about half a dozen camping trips before the plastic around the air valves developed gaping holes. The company won't replace it because I found the problem a few weeks after the one year warranty. They do not care that the product uses inferior materials and started falling apart. The mattress was only used inside a camper, not on the ground so it wasn't punctured or damaged by me in any way. Don't buy it. If you must, you better check it before one year.
customer_reviews.author: Laura E. Lindler

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I was super nervous to use these while out camping. We did not have the time to set them up at home before we left for our week long camping trip, so the first use was the first night camping! I am a 30 something woman weighing 260, and the 3 inches make me scared. But to my surprise I slept well! These are comfortable with a nice pillow (would not recommend using without your own pillow). After laying it out I did add a few extra puffs of air and it was good to go for the week! I never had to add or decrease any air the entire trip!!!! This is a must have!!!
customer_reviews.author: Goldsmith/Thomas

customer_reviews.title: 5*  product
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd purchase. I’d had concerns about durability when I first bought one. (because of other reviews) Those concerns have been alleviated. I’ve used the 1st one nearly every month 2-4 days at a time for over a year. It’s been fabulous. I love this mat and will be expanding my use hence the second mat. The next use as a mat during Holotropic Breathwork will raise the level of durability testing. I anticipate it will hold up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, but packing up isn’t easy
customer_reviews.text: This is the best overall self-inflating sleeping pad for comfort. It is quiet and comfortable. The downsides are the size when packed up (it’s heavy compared to other options and doesn’t pack down small) and the difficulty in deflating to pack it up (you have to “deflate” it a few times before you can roll it up and have it fit in the storage bag). I have some thinner and lighter self-inflating sleeping pads that are much easier to put away and are way more compact to carry. However, this sleeping pad is so comfortable that I prefer it when speed of packing up isn’t a priority.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesone!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, i am 5'10'' and about 240 lbs. When i bought this for my camping trip i was sceptical that it would be comfortable. This thing is great! I slept on it for 2 nights and slept way better than anyone who slpet on an expensive giant air mattress. If you are going back and forth on whether to get this, do it! You will not regret it! It is super easy to inflate and roll back up! Plus it comes with a carry bag. Im a very happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Cole

customer_reviews.title: Plastic inflation cap broke, cracked ! Don't get stuck in the woods with this pad.
customer_reviews.text: After minimal usage, the screw down plastic cap on one inflation port cracked all the way around the top, making it impossible to hold air or function properly. Its useless now. My only solution is to completely epoxy over that one port and inflate and deflate with one port. But I won't venture into the wild with faulty equipment, and I would suggest you not depend on this pad in the outdoors!
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: So far they are everything they state the are!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two mattress, and will take them both out camping this weekend coming up. The instructions say to inflate them prior to the first use for at least 24 hours and I would agree. The are vacuum sealed out of the box and it take a bit for it to fully inflate. However, after that it only mine just a couple minutes to inflate. I plan to just open then up after we get the camp site set and then just before bed close down the valves for a restful night sleep. Note: I am a bigger guy in weight and have yet touched the floor with my body once I am fully on the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: David Foos

customer_reviews.title: After a few nights, doesn't hold air anymore
customer_reviews.text: It's soft and super comfy when you go to bed on it. After using if for a few days i wake up on the hard ground with backaches. Due to the way it's made, and the material it's made of, I don't even know how to start checking it for leaks... It's also so narrow when I lay on my back, my hands fall/hang off the pad.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Before you go on your trip, inflate it to make sure it works properly.
customer_reviews.text: Not really happy. Took it on my trip and when I went to inflate it, one of the caps had a crack all around it and it did not stay inflated. My 10 day trip in the mountains ended up very uncomfortable. Wish I didn't have to put any stars
customer_reviews.author: Debie Whittington

customer_reviews.title: Speedlight comfortable & wide.
customer_reviews.text: More comfortable for me than an inflatable air mattress. Unrolled Lightspeed mattress and it “self-inflated/enlarged, let it continue until bedtime, then blew a little more air into its base. Slept comfortably with Lightspeed mattress laid upon on carpeted floor. Much easier to roll over onto side sleeping position than on air mattress. Lightspeed is wide enough too, will support 6’; 250 lbs. plus guy. Storage bag has ample enough space so that one doesn’t have to work too hard to roll mattress back up and put it away. Very pleased so far. Speedlight mattress would be great to take along for camping also.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rockwell

customer_reviews.title: gets an easy 5 from me
customer_reviews.text: gets an easy 5 from me, BUT understand this, you are buying a mat that is larger and heavier than the cut down (tapered) and thinner options, you 'could' walk around with this one strapped to the side of your pack and you will get a great nights sleep but if you are moving every day and you are the type of packer that cuts tooth brush handles off to reduce weight then this may not be for you. All that aside if you are getting to the campsite in a vehicle and sleeping more than one night in the same place.... YOU NEED THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Ad

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust the positive headlines!
customer_reviews.text: I really thought I was getting a good mat for camping. I was wrong. This thing is like sleeping on the ground. Do not trust the positive reviews. Way too much money for garbage. Worst part is I would have returned it, but I bought it in advance so now I’m just stuck with this piece of crap. Don’t buy it!!
customer_reviews.author: victoria

customer_reviews.title: but super comfortable and warm even for my 6 foot 200-pound ...
customer_reviews.text: Big, heavy, but super comfortable and warm even for my 6-foot 200-pound frame. The only wish is that the cover material was not so slippery, as sleeping bags tend to slide off too easily. And BTW, it's BIG. My eight-year-old kid even has room to snuggle with me on it. Getting a tight roll on four of these when breaking camp is a bit of a chore, but following the two-step instructions helps. And as they should be stored uncompressed to avoid ruining the loft, you need plenty of space to keep them at home, because they are BIG. :)
customer_reviews.author: Irl R. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item (along with others that will also get reviews) to use in a converted utility trailer. Everything arrived on schedule with Prime and all contents were properly packed. There were no shipping issues at all. I have used the mattress once now on a plywood "bed" and IT IS EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE! You cannot feel anything under the mattress! I had a great night sleep on this.
customer_reviews.author: Upgrade

customer_reviews.title: really comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Use was on floor of house when 'sleeping over' where no guest room available. First use, blew into them a little to make sure fully inflated, then close valves. Were a little less thick than expected, not really 3inches thick, but not too much less than that. It is a very comfortable sleep. I've had problems with other camping mattresses in same situation, but this was great. Really couldn't feel the floor, even when sleeping on side...elbows, knees, and shoulders weren't able to push through to floor. And the little rise in the pillow area was nice.
customer_reviews.author: James Bianchi

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but Hard to Deflate
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable. I slept really well on this. It's pretty firm but plushy. Only downside is, while it's very easy to inflate (just need to open the air valves), it's hard for me to deflate. The air inflating is very powerful, and for every bit of air I manage to squeeze out, a good bit will come back in once I shift my body weight. Finally I got someone else to help me, using both of our knees to push out the air as we slowly roll up the pad. Also, might not be so convenient if you're planning to take this to backpacking. It's a little bulky, and quite wide.
customer_reviews.author: H. Zhu

customer_reviews.title: To a good night sleep...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I got it in on a Thursday, took it out camping that weekend and found it to be very nice and comfy! It "self" inflated right away, a little slow, but you can blow it to help speed it up as well as to add firmness. I slept well on it all through the night! The next day, I let all the air out to see if it would self fill faster. It did... I am very happy with my purchase and plan on putting it to more good use!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great product...but received used item.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon sent me a used or returned item. It was missing original packaging, and tag with instructions. It was inflated when I received it, so full of air it was hard to remove from its bag. Also was missing the replacement valve that comes with new purchase. I know all this because a few days later I ordered a second one which did come with all the original packaging and parts. The product itself is great. Perfect fit on top of my Coleman XL cot.
customer_reviews.author: Kat2068

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for side sleepers. My husband will occasionally use it to sleep on the floor if his back is bothering him because it usually makes him feel better. It is quite large but I was already expecting that. It was comical to see it attached to my backpack. Haven't take it out in the woods yet but I do believe that it would be better to deal with a little awkwardness than to have a bad nights sleep. To me it was worth getting. I don't feel the floor when I rest on it. Extremely comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed - easy set up
customer_reviews.text: I used this for two nights of camping and it actually worked really well. So easy to inflate (literally just twist the two nobs & wait) and easy to deflate, sort of hard to roll up, but the concept itself is super simple. The bag that it comes with is an appropriate size and you don’t have to struggle to fit the mattress inside of it. This is largely in part to the fact that there are two Velcro straps to wrap around & secure the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: mandykepner

customer_reviews.title: We found the answer!
customer_reviews.text: Researched the heck out of these and I'm quite pleased with my choice. Got them to make a hide-a-bed more tolerable in our motorhome. Unrolled 'em and opened the valves...and left overnight as per instructions. Next morning they were indeed 3" thick (with no add'l inflation) and super comfortable. The Mrs preferred hers a bit less firm so we left some air out to about the 2 1/2" mark. Everybody's happy! Well constructed and they did indeed "stay put". The glowing reviews are right on the money, so add my 5 stars to the mix. Woot!
customer_reviews.author: bubba

customer_reviews.title: Best self-inflating mattress we've found so far!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for camping AND to use when putting kids to bed. We've lost three different self-inflating mattresses in the past 6 months due to slow leaks. So far, this one is air tight. Also, it is soooo comfortable! So comfortable that we end up sleeping the whole night in the kids room! Usually we'd wake up after an hour or so with a sore shoulder or numb leg - not the case with this one. As for camping - we intend on using it car camping. So no issue with its larger size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Khosravifar

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate buy it now!!
customer_reviews.text: We camp a lot and the one thing we just couldn’t figure out is a good night sleep! We have tried every blow up mattress out there and cots! Nothing worked! I spent a lot of time researching and reading reviews on different sleeping pads. I honestly never thought a self inflating sleeping pad would be the answer to our prayers! This pad is absolutely amazing! It is so comfortable and conforms to your body and it never loses air! I highly recommend investing in this pad!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT, even for a big guy
customer_reviews.text: Amazing - I'm a big guy (6'2, 300+ pounds) - and this is SO comfortable that I even use it in my home office for naps. It filled up quickly via the left nozzle (if I'm at the top of the pad) and then I used the right nozzle to blow it up some more. It has stayed inflated at this level for 3-4 days without any additional air and I've used it several times in that span. I can't wait to use this camping. :)
customer_reviews.author: Robert Young

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect it to be as comfortable as it is! The only downside is how low it is to the ground, which is only an issue for getting up in the morning as I get older. It's nice to not touch the ground, and as a side sleeper that is a big deal for me. I'll use it for a night or two but for any longer I'll put the pad on top of cushions or something to raise it. It isn't small so probably best for car camping, not backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: It is very comfortable. I recommend this to any one who camps
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions and let it inflate overnight when I received it. It only took a few puffs in the morning to get it adjusted to my desired firmness. I cannot believe how plush this thing is. It is very comfortable. I recommend this to any one who camps. If your a minimalist hiker this would be a little to bulky however light speed makes more compact ones.
customer_reviews.author: Judgement

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sleeping pad!
customer_reviews.text: What an incredible sleeping pad! It is super thick, very soft foam inside, and inflates quickly. Comparing it to a Thermarest basecamp pad, this pad is thicker, much quieter (less noise when shifting around and you were sleeping bag), doesn’t slide around as much on a cot, much more comfortable, inflates faster, and is wider. If I was really concerned with the size, I would probably go with the Thermarest. I bought this pad for overlanding, and space was not as much of a concern compared to backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Vman

customer_reviews.title: This sleeping pad is a must have for campers
customer_reviews.text: I've been camping for many years and I can say with confidence this sleeping pad is one of the most robust built sleeping pad and one of the most comfortable I've ever used in my life. I highly recommend this sleeping pad. This is the only sleeping pad you'll ever want. I'm also a big man and this sleeping pad was comfortable. Just make sure to blow air into it as much as you can
customer_reviews.author: AXHEJAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping mats
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. They self inflate without need for more inflation. Because they also have foam they are warm unlike an air mattress and very comfortable. They are also the widest I found, no rolling off of them. Also fairly easy to deflate. If you follow manufacturers directions. Large, somewhat heavy. Great for car camping or sleeping bags on hard floors but backpacking would be rough!
customer_reviews.author: beachcat50

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold air, leaks from the material on the top of the pad.
customer_reviews.text: This pad provides excellent insulation from the ground on those cold weather campouts. However, they do not hold air. I have purchased four of these over the past few years and each one began leaking after about 10 nights. The strange thing is, the holes are not on the bottom of the pad. When testing in water, the top of the pad bubbles all over. Not like a few single holes but hundreds or even thousands of holes all over the top of the pad. Too bad, if it held air it would be the best option for comfortable camping.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: After reading a bunch of reviews, I decided to get 2 of these for our upcoming camping trip. I am in love. So comfortable and easy to set up and dismantle. The one thing I was worried about, as I always am when products come with a carry bag, was that after I deflated these that they would be difficult or impossible to get back in their bags. I was wrong. The bags are generous in size so even if all of the air is not fully deflated it will still fit. 5 stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Katie P

customer_reviews.title: Valve Broke After 4 Uses
customer_reviews.text: At first I was really impressed with the comfort and weight of this pad. I purchased it 2 years ago haven't needed it very often, which means it has barely been used. I pulled it out for only the 5th time the other day, only to find that one of the valve caps had completely snapped off. Since this is what keeps air in the pad, it's now completely useless. Save your money and buy something that will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: These are Magic and Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical and did a ton of research before purchasing but these worked out great on our last camping trip. I inflated and deflated them a few times before going on the trip. Inflation is effortless and while deflating takes a little more work, I was able to get them back into their cases. On the second night of camping I actually deflated mine a tiny bit to make it more cushy and slept great. Personally I cannot see using anything smaller than 30" in width.
customer_reviews.author: RichP

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: We bought Byer of Maine Easy Cots and these Lightspeed 4 inch pads. Camping in a tent was comfy and we both slept really well without back aches. We can extend our camping years! A bonus is that no pump is needed and setting the pads up is quiet. Just 2-4 extra puffs with the funny blow bag and all is set. Have already recommended to a friend!
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent alternative to the Lightspeed Ultra Pulsh XL
customer_reviews.text: I don’t leave reviews much but the positive customer service experience made me want give them 5 stars. This is an excellent alternative to the Lightspeed Ultra Pulsh XL. I have both products I’m very happy with both. The flexform fabric on the top makes a huge difference in the comfort. One benefit most people don’t realize is that you don’t get mold problems in these pads because they are air sealed. A huge perk when you’re camping in a tent or a car, especially in rainy high humidity situations. I recommend this product a lot and some of my friends bougt and are happily using it.
customer_reviews.author: catalysist

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic and amazing.
customer_reviews.text: These camp mats are as cushy as they come! Very easy to use, inflated automatically when the valve was opened, and held their air for our first time using them on a 3 day camping trip. They appear to be well made and high quality - which is what I hoped for at that price point. They were a little more difficult to deflate and roll up compared to other (cheaper, poorer quality) mats I've used in the past, but that's a small price to pay for that cushy foam layer! Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Mole

customer_reviews.title: So comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I gave in and decided to spend the money and take the risk on this sleeping pad, and I'm so glad I did. I generally do not like camping or "roughing it" but my husband does, so I was really wanting to invest in something comfortable. This is so comfy I can actually sleep on my side or stomach without a problem. Much better than an air mattress and easier to inflate. We got two since they only come in twin sizes, but a queen size fitted sheet actually fit around them both perfectly to help them stay together and keep them clean. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa F.

customer_reviews.title: little wider than another mat we have which is nice. Put wool blanket under this pad and then ...
customer_reviews.text: Used in tent for one night so far. little wider than another mat we have which is nice. Put wool blanket under this pad and then sleeping bag directly on top of pad. Did not have issue with cold air coming from the bottom like I do when sleeping on an air mattress. It was very comfy, no issues at all with feeling the lumpy ground.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, easy to set up and take down
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for truck camping with a tent and for use as a palate for kids sleep overs. This mat is just as advertised - thick, comfortable, easy to set up and take down. I am very impressed with its comfort. I'm 43 y/o and I've been camping my whole life and have slept on everything from sand to the old spring, fold up type cots from WalMart and wish I had one of these back then. I have an oversized cot with a thick sleep pad now and this pad is right up there with my high rated cot/pad combo. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: gdx2

customer_reviews.title: Best nights sleep while tent camping!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t leave amazon reviews but this sleeping mat was so good I’m leaving one! By far the best nights sleep I’ve had while tent camping! Last time we used an air mattress, this time that wasn’t an option so I bought these to try hoping it would be one step better than the ground. They were fantastic! They were even better than laying on the air mattress and not as noisy, much more comfortable and overall allowed more room in the tent. I plan on buying 2 more before our next camping trip for our boys to have one also instead of the yoga mats they currently use. Looking forward to using them again.
customer_reviews.author: RNJess2008

customer_reviews.title: AVOID THIS PRODUCT .... FLAWED PRODUCT -- FAULTY VALVES
customer_reviews.text: it's like playing roulette to try to avoid a defective one. This mattress would have been great if the company stood behind it as mentioned in other reviews -- they do not. We purchased 2 of them and got one of the valves that fail after a few uses. When the valve failed the cap also cracked. I was charged $5.00 to try a cap replacement. When that didn't work, the customer service response was "Sorry". Given the high cost of these mattresses, I would expect the company to compensate their customers and address this issue which they already know about. You're on your own if you take a chance on this pricey item.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: I woke up with none of the usual aches and pains after sleeping on the ground.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! No aches and stiffness in the mornings! I was really worried about tent camping, as I am on a medication which causes joint pain and muscle stiffness/soreness. I felt as good as if I had slept on a bed! It doesn't roll up quite as small as my old ones, but if I'm not camping out of my kayak, that doesn't matter. It is really nice to have a wider mat and be able to roll over! I highly recommend this sleep mat!
customer_reviews.author: emcmeaner

customer_reviews.title: No more pain from the hard ground!
customer_reviews.text: This bed is great! Before my husband and I bought this, when we would go camping, my hip would dig into the ground at night on the thin pad I was using to sleep on. On this last camping trip with this camping mattress, I slept so much better!! No pain in the hip. I couldn't even feel the hardness of the ground like before. So thankful and would highly recommend it. It inflates quickly (read the instructions on how to inflate the first time) and is ready to go in minutes. Very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Joyful

customer_reviews.title: great when they hold air, not so good when they don't
customer_reviews.text: I bought five of these in 2017. Have used them once a year for an annual 4 day camping trip. Unfortunately, two of them stopped holding air last year. I have put them under water to try to find the leak in order to repair but no bubbles show. Very disappointing to have paid $80+ for something that I only got 2 seasons out of. The remaining 3 mats look good for this year, 2020, but will update the review if they don't make it the five nights upcoming...
customer_reviews.author: nicola folkes

customer_reviews.title: It is small - will not fit 2 people comfortably
customer_reviews.text: The reason I gave it three stars was because it is small, I'm 160 female and this definitely will not fit two people comfortably. I wish I would have known becuse I would have not gotten in especially with the price. However the only positive thing is, this mattress is super easy to set up and take down and it is very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Anna cummings

customer_reviews.title: It's really  comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I use it for our grandkids as a bed, it wonderful. I was thinking about getting it as a workout mat. Love it and would differently wreck a mend it. Ive only had it a short time, so as far as knowing how long it would last not sure. I think as long as you didn't jump up and down on it it would last.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Newsom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Camping
customer_reviews.text: This mattress surprised me! It is very easy to inflate. Just open up the valves, unroll it and it basically inflates itself. I added a little more air just to firm it up a little bit more, but it was very easy considering I used my mouth to blow it up the rest of the way. I have been using it for more than a week now, because I just recently moved from Japan and my furniture still has not arrived. I have to say that it has been more than comfortable and I am not having any back pains from it, which is a surprise to me. So, I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: With this self Inflated pads not only it’s easy to inflate
customer_reviews.text: We used to take our blow up mattresses with us on our camping trips. We had to bring the air pump batteries, patching kits and at the end of the night the mattress was still deflated and uncomfortable!! With this self Inflated pads not only it’s easy to inflate, no pump needed ! It’s light to carry. It was also the most comfortable sleep I ever had while camping! Sleep on my side and did not feel the ground at all!! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: SLavida

customer_reviews.title: But it's very comfortable and not too bulky to carry (a lot less ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, loving it!! I hope it lasts. But it's very comfortable and not too bulky to carry (a lot less than I imagined). I'm happy with the purchase and already used twice - one time to put it on top of a rollaway bed at the hotel that was really uncomfortable and another to use as an extra bed at my sister's house. Great!!!
customer_reviews.author: MCand

customer_reviews.title: hands down the best, can't imaging camping without it again
customer_reviews.text: I am in LOVE with this sleeping pad. Got it for camping, and it has made sleeping so much more comfortable. The pad is easy to carry, unrolls and inflates easily, and is nice and thick on the ground. The material is soft and squishy, not slippery at all, so I don't slip around at night.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Very happy 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! Inflates quickly after recommended initial overnight inflating. My camping buddies we're definitely jealous 😁 Not super easy to roll up and put away, but these things never are. Tip: I roll it up and deflate as much as possible, then let it out and re-roll it real quick right afterwards and that seems to work pretty well. I would recommend this to anyone and the price is great compared to other self-inflated sleeping pads like what I've seen at REI.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great sleep
customer_reviews.text: I’m a side sleeper and I get bruised by mattresses that are too stiff. Even a little bit firm. This was a great camping mattress. It doesn’t make noise when you move around or feel like plastic. And it’s big enough that you shouldn’t roll off if you move around in your sleep.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: First one didn't last...
customer_reviews.text: Update: customer service phenomenal. After contacting them about my mat spontaneously failing, they shipped out a replacement, no questions asked. I've only used it so far on a cot in my livingroom, but I'm looking forward to testing it out in the woods in a few weeks. ***** The 3rd time using this and it has stopped holding air. It's currently 2am and I'm camping and I can't fall asleep because I'm basically sleeping on the ground with no cushioning. I've reinflated it twice already. Without the air, the memory foam condenses to nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I slept exclusively on this pad for the better part of 6 months, and felt quite comfortable on it. I did have a problem where one of the inflater caps broke, but the manufacturer quickly shipped a new one to me. I don't really know if a better recommendation then it was good enough for me to sleep on for half a year.
customer_reviews.author: HandyDan

customer_reviews.title: Still this pad is a lot better than having nothing at all
customer_reviews.text: I took this mat on a elk hunt in Colorado. Definitely not a mat you would use to pack in somewhere. I used it on a cot that was in a trailer. As the other reviews state, to inflate before going out in the field. This sped up the inflation the second it was set up. It did not feel as though I was on an air mattress but I still felt some pressure points on my hip throughout the week. Still this pad is a lot better than having nothing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: ... this for two weeks in Nepal and it was awesome. I felt like I was sleeping on a ...
customer_reviews.text: Slept on the this for two weeks in Nepal and it was awesome. I felt like I was sleeping on a mattress. Takes about 10 big breaths to fully inflate, but you could sleep on it without adding breaths if you like a soft surface. Open both valves when you want to roll it up and close them when you get to the end and it easily fits back in the bag. It's long, but not very heavy. LOVE THIS MAT!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Tornetta

customer_reviews.title: Large sized, seriously comfortable mat.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I was so comfortable! A couple of extra breaths of air after it inflated, and I slept great. Definitely beats a regular air bed. Besides camping, it is my new stargazing pad. To roll it up, open the valves, roll it up to let the air out, close the valves. Then unroll, and reroll tightly with valves closed, and let the remaining air out of one valve at the very end, and close it back up.
customer_reviews.author: A.L.

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Update: I bought two of these and we've been on probably 10-12 camping trips with them over 3 years. One is still functioning properly but sadly the other will not stay inflated and that makes a huge difference in comfort level. This seems to be a common problem so I will not be repurchasing this brand. Original review: Worth every penny. It really is like sleeping on a mattress, so very, very comfortable. I've never slept so well camping before. Deflating and rolling up doesn't take very long and it fits well back into its sack and inflating takes less than a minute. You roll it out, puff a little extra air and voila!
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Gotta get it!
customer_reviews.text: This sleep pad is worth its weight in gold! Takes about 5-10 min to fully self inflate. A little self air will top it off. I have used this a few times and have not been disappointed at all. I weight about 2340 and it did not leak air like an air mattress would normally do. I highly recommend this! Get it! You wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: I stay over at friends houses a lot and they don't always have a spare bed. so I invested in this little sleeping pad and I absolutely love it. definitely let it inflate fully before you try to sleep on it!! slept like a baby
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: which I consider the best praise one can give it
customer_reviews.text: I went camping at 34-35 degrees with this pad (relatively warm days for mid-winter where we were, so the ground was a bit colder with 1-2 feet snowpack on top). I didn't even think about this pad, which I consider the best praise one can give it. I felt comfortable, and I felt warm. I'm 6'1" and 265 lbs, and I like to sleep sprawled out so the increased size was helpful also.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Rajlich

customer_reviews.title: Great value, very comfy
customer_reviews.text: WOW, this thing is amazing. Well worth the price. It's warm and comfortable. You have to really give it a good half hour the first time you open it for it to inflate fully. But once it's inflated, it's very puffy and comfy. For reference, I'm 5'4" and 165 lbs. I do not feel the ground, and I do not feel any pressure points or pain using this.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't look any further!! I was a bit skeptical- I'm 260 lbs- this mattress remained very comfortable all night! Not affected by very cold conditions like the rest. Finally a light weight mattress that is quality and comfort! You won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Glee

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with how easily this inflated. I found it easy to roll up by compressing as much air out until the end, close the air vents. Then unrolling it out (keeping the air vents closed) and rolling it back up tighter, then open the air vents again towards the end of the roll to release the last bit of air and sealing the vent again for storage. I'll never get it back to the original packaging tightness but this sleeping pad stores away pretty compact already with all our other camping gear. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Success, at last!!
customer_reviews.text: As comfortable and easy to inflate and deflate as I could imagine a camping pad could be. I bought a Kamp-Rite cot to go with it. I'm a side sleeper and have back/hip pain. This made camping in a tent bearable. I've tried many different pads, air mattresses and other options and this was the first comfortable nights' sleep I've had in a tent in years.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but be sure it won't be too big.
customer_reviews.text: Very thick, very comfortable, very wide, very big (so it's great to lay on but hard to pack away because rolled up it's really a pretty wide roll. I did write and ask a question to one of their broadcast emails asking how I like it, and got no response to my question. (One star off)
customer_reviews.author: Araz

customer_reviews.title: super comfy
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfy camp pad i have ever used. It is bulkier than the thermoflex but totally worth it if you have the space. As with all air mattresses you have to take care not to poke with sharp objects.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with Defective valves!!!!
customer_reviews.text: With all the 5 star reviews I expected to get a quality product. There are two inflation valves that you open to allowing the mattress to self-inflate. One of the valves is cracked and won't tighten down. What a disappointment. Now to go through all the hassle of the return process!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Telis

customer_reviews.title: Sleeps like a big cloud
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable self-inflating sleeping pad. It's quite long too. I'm a thin 5'10" and had PLENTY of mat above my head and below my toes. Got the widest one because why not. Was plenty comfortable and not once did I roll off it in my sleep. As indicated, it IS necessary to let it self inflate for about a day the first time you use it. This really allows the air to infiltrate the foamy stuffing and puff up properly. If you do this, you'll be sleeping on a cloud.
customer_reviews.author: cmiddleton

customer_reviews.title: Valve caps are fragile
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product until the valve caps at the end broke. Not just one, but both ends broke. Also slowly leaked at night to where I'd wake up touching the floor in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Hamaboy

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Way to flat. Maybe one inch.
customer_reviews.text: meh, too flat for how big it is. I can get thicking inflaring foam mattresses for the same size. Completely felt the floor beneath me. Better than the ground but there are better products out there for the bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Mlarsen1

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping pad!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these for our roof top tent as the mattress it comes with isn't that great. I have a bad back from a car accident years ago and I sleep great on these. They are also easy to inflate and deflate. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: mlrober

customer_reviews.title: Excellent air mattress/Pad!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had thermarest pads for camping and this pad is bigger, thicker and is perfect for car camping and rent camping. We have an RV that has a sofa the makes a bed and is uneven and this pad is perfect. It give you support and evens out the bumps and at the same time gives you the comfortable cushion to soften it up!!! It’s easy to inflate as it will self inflate quickly and deflates quickly. Love this pad!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R. Barger

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the pad a week before I needed it. No cracks in the valves. I also allowed it to self-inflate for a few days. This pad is SUPER comfortable! The R rating is spot on. I have always been cold while camping (0 degree bag in July??!!!) Well, for the last 2 nights, I've been sweating like crazy. Too hot for summer use. But the comfort.... I look forward to winter use!
customer_reviews.author: penname

customer_reviews.title: Sleeping in the woods just got upgraded
customer_reviews.text: Added this as a topper to the Teton XXL cots we bought and I’m asking myself why I didn’t do this sooner. The softer exterior is very quiet and somewhat helps keep the sleeping bag in place. Warmer that sleeping on the air mattress for sure and much closer to a real bed. No regrets whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It was great and feels kind of like sleeping on memory foam. Very easy to set up and great to the touch. It is firm enough to make small rocks and uneven ground seem as non-existent. It takes a little more time to roll up tightly and put in bag, but it's worth it for the comfort level you get with this!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping pad is incredible. I have used many pads in the past, and this is by far the most comfortable. I'm a side sleeper and my hips and shoulders were very comfortable during the night. I'm currently renting a room and I have started using this pad to sleep on the floor since it is so much more comfortable than the bed. It is a little heavy for backpacking, but I would be tempted to take it anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is unbelievably comfortable. I haven’t used it outdoors yet
customer_reviews.text: This is unbelievably comfortable. I haven’t used it outdoors yet, but rolled it out at home and my partner, who has a nice REI pad, was instantly envious. A little challenging to re-roll because of how much air it takes in, but nothing too bad...just follow the directions. Looking forward to using this while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Best Pad I Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: After months of use I can tell you this I'd Absolutely the most comfortable pad I have ever used! Very soft and supportive at the same time. Inflated and deflated easily. A heavy weight person can sleep on it and not bottom out. So happy with it. The only con if there is one, is that it is a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Southpaw Bushcraft

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable at all.
customer_reviews.text: To call this “super plush” is laughable! It’s more like a thick piece of cardboard that will have your back in knots by the time you wake up. I doubt I’ll ever use it again. An air mattress is worth it even if you have to blow it up vs this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: JUST AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Best Sleeping Pad I have Ever Purchased and Laid on! (I know longer sleep on a typical bed - - threw these out already - - LOL! . . . AND I never get a backache sleeping on this Lightspeed Flexform 3.0 mat)
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynSlim

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, Yet not.
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought it. Wanted to test it out; Easy to air up, Very comfortable to the touch as well. However when sleeping on it, it's a very stiff experience. Waking up with spine/lower back pain and if I laid on my side i woke up with chest pain on the side. overall it would probably be good if you put one on top of the other for a more comfortable sleep. It's just too thin for me to really say it's comfortable when sleeping on it. Also I'm not a heavy person at all, 130lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with the quality and ease of inflating. It was great to add to the top of an air mattress for camping and for putting on hard mattresses when staying in hotels.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Talley

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 6 months and about 5-6 time uses
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED (May 29, 2019): The cap broke and it can no longer hold air. Now every times I lay on it I hear the deflating sounds. OLD: (Purchased November, 2018) I like my comfort level high so i blow air into it to make sure its fluffy. Used on camping site with minimal rocks surface and work great.
customer_reviews.author: Kenshin Vu

customer_reviews.title: Be Comfortable worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: Its very nice I wanted to sleep on it the first night I got it had to fight my family off it to let it air up for the first night. Got this for work since sometimes I have to sleep at the office its very comfy worth the money would recommend it to my coworkers.
customer_reviews.author: NoraEG

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, good sleep.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for motorcycle camping, much more comfortable and convenient than an air mattress. Last year, I just used the camp pad. This year I also purchased a cot, and use pad on the cot, which is a perfect combination. Would purchase again, very pleased with the self inflating pad.
customer_reviews.author: Andy from WI

customer_reviews.title: Self-inflating
customer_reviews.text: Good for camping, but too large and heavy for backpacking. Super soft covering and easy to inflate (self-inflates), but you can always add a little more air to the mattress.
customer_reviews.author: P. Salg

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy, and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've never slept so comfortably when camping before. I didn't feel the ground, but I also didn't get that weird floaty sensation you get from air-filled pads. Setup was a breeze, but packing it away took some effort. I can see why it comes with an oversized bag, because squeezing all of the air out isn't easy. Nonetheless, I'm happy with it, and would totally buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Kelley

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!  no more hip pain!
customer_reviews.text: The self-inflation was perfect, did not need to add more air. I'm a side sleeper and our old air mattress caused me to wake up with terrible hip pain after about 2 hours. That doesn't happen with this pad! Yes they cost more (we bought 2) but I think it was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: dunringill

customer_reviews.title: Best EVER for ppl with bad backs!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible! I have a bad back and worry about sleep comfort. I found my fix! Its doesnt have an automatic pump. You open the valve and it inflates. Its so super fast, lightweight and feels like memory foam! I was hesitant to pay $84 for this as I needed 2, but worth every cent! I researched sleep pads for about two weeks and finally decided to buy these as the reviews were great. My daughter and I absolutely love them. Stop searching...this is THE ONE!
customer_reviews.author: Mareesa

customer_reviews.title: A GOOD NIGHTS SLEEP!
customer_reviews.text: I have the Forest River Surveyor expandable trailer. The two queen beds have cushions that are not thick/dense enough. By morning, my hips are tender. I turn from side to side throughout the night because of this. I purchased this sleeping pad in hopes it would resolve the issue. It only took one night to fall in love with this sleeping pad. I had the best nights sleep in the trailer since we bought it in 2008. No tossing during the night and no sore hips in the morning. If you are having the same issue, give this pad a try. You won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Marta Kline

product_meta.title: Lightspeed Outdoors XL Super Plush FlexForm Premium Self-Inflating Insulated Sleep and Camp Foam Pad | Extra Thick Sleep Mat
feature_bullets: Open size: 77" x 30" x 3" Rolled size: 30" x 7.75" Weight: 6.0 lbs

Maximum R-Value of 9.66 keeps you exceptionally warm; Lightspeed's special non slip stretch material hugs your body, while the 3" thick no bottoming out soft foam offers insulation and support. Non-PVC materials eliminates plastic odors and plastic crinkle noises for a more peaceful night sleep
Dual oversize air valves for quick self inflating and deflating without the need for a pump
Integrated pillow for additional comfort, included compression straps and oversized carry bag
A great substitution to an air bed or mattress; Perfect for family camping or visiting guests
